CAkN_lqh2iXAl-e5k2Y44g.text: Had the breakfast platter  - great comfort food breakfast meal.  Coffee hot and strong.  Classic western PA town environment on a side street.  It was game day so lots of locals in their Steelers garb coming in added to the whole thing.  I would definitely recommend this to anyone, and will come back myself.

Hq7kYuMMGP2Oc9oFSSOusQ.text: We so wanted to love this new breakfast place in Emsworth.  Be advised that it is very tiny and just opened.  On he positive side, the prices are very reasonable.  On the negative, they need to turn the grill hood on.  Pancakes were excellent, eggs, not so much.  Check back in a few months to see if they get the kinks worked out.

h8ppHH32cuzP5ppY6jcm5A.text: Great local family owned diner situated in the heart of Emsworth. Atmosphere is welcoming and the food is more than reasonably priced. It's always great to see Chev himself behind the counter. Would personally recommend a breakfast bowel or burger when hungry.

864OkmzlSH-rmq-sORTHag.text: Awesome food!  We had strawberry French toast..  fresh strawberry!  Just the right amount of sweet.  Also had a Reuben but the best part were the home fries.   Can't wait to go back!

1PB-cnwa6oTdxLG_zefg2Q.text: Great little secret in Emsworth. If you happen to be in town in the morning or early afternoon you must stop by this place. Great breakfast menu at a great price.

sRFHG_AB6721y7ISFdDgRg.text: A very cute mom and pop run diner in Emsworth.  This is a very small place, on an interesting road that seemed more residential than commercial.  The service was fast and friendly, portions were large, and food was very hearty.  I got the pulled pork omelet with home fries, she got the french toast.  All was good, tasty diner food.  Of particular note were the home fries - crunchy on the outside, firm (but well cooked) and not mushy on the inside, and well seasoned.  They were excellent.

RceJk4DfiwtBjf6HaTioqQ.text: Pancakes the size of the plate! Absolutely delicious diner fare. Highly recommend stopping in.

LBnkXDWNqE49AgJlpKR7vw.text: This is a great neighborhood find with good, simple food and friendly service. It's small but breakfast and lunch do not take long so the tables turn quickly. The coffee was very good and my wife and I are picky about our coffee. We both had French toast and bacon and it was delicious. We will be back!

q2Xm_o-9kB91U8hdoR8i1Q.text: Found this place on yelp. Glad we did. Great little diner for breakfast and lunch. I did the breakfast sandwich which was much larger than I was anticipating and my girlfriend got a salad which she really enjoyed.

CV0XKn4Gf5H7xT6RAkVtKQ.text: Stumbled on this place because our regular breakfast place was closed,  and boy I'm I glad we did! Excellent food, reasonably priced and very friendly fast service.  Will definitely be back!

l9pAM5OBv4HfZz1XANnKew.text: Great breakfast and staff goes above and beyond.  Hometown friendly place!  Highly recommend!

KZStHJp84pUZxX8M4i7F0A.text: When I read in the Post-Gazette that Chev and Rachel's was opening not 5 minutes from where I work overnights, I could not be more excited.  All I needed to do was convince my co-workers to give it a try...which really wasn't difficult.  At 7am on a winter morning the store front that is Chev and Rachel's is like a bacon calling me home.  Uh, I mean beacon.  The owner, there by himself for the first hour or so, was happy to greet us.  Upon sitting down there were a couple little things I noticed that impressed me.  First, under my utencils was not one, not two, but instead a generous pile of napkins.  Things can get messy when it comes to me and food and I like when a restaurant lets me be liberal with my napkin usage.  The second thing I noticed, which has nothing to do with the food, was a bag of pet friendly ice melt inside the door.  As a pet owner, it's nice to see a business owner who cares like that.  Especially when I saw several dogs walk by the door.  The menu isn't all that adventurous but what they do offer is well executed.  The chocolate chip pancakes are massive.  My Breakfast Bowl was a delicious mixture of potatoes, eggs, onions, cheese and bacon with some Mancini's toast added.  The prices were reasonable (my breakfast bowl plus side of toast was under $10 with tip) but be advised they are cash only and the dining room is very small.  Still, if you can squeeze your way in, give it a try.  My one star deduction is only because, as David B pointed out, they need to turn on the grill hood.  I don't mind smelling like the diner itself, but not when the diner smells like it might be on fire.  Perhaps during warmer weather when the doors can be left open that will help.  Until then, I'll give it another go.

photos.caption: Photo of Chev & Rachel's Family Diner - Emsworth, PA, United States
Photo of Chev & Rachel's Family Diner - Emsworth, PA, United States. The Breakfast Bowl
Photo of Chev & Rachel's Family Diner - Emsworth, PA, United States

852JWreTRoedlRUNDnfpMg.text: Owner operated local family restaurant that serves amazing food. I've always felt welcomed and at home when eating here. Eat here, you won't regret it.

T7BUOKcbVGW0O05GELofSA.text: Love this place.  This is your quintessential family diner. They run fairly unique daily specials, think Bob's Burgers unique, like pierogi omelets.  They also make breakfast bowls and decent home fries.  Their eggs are good and the service is fast.  If you are looking for a trendy or hipster place this is not it but if you are looking for an honest diner breakfast at a good price, you are in luck.

GdGNELSQg7ONKz8to1BZvg.text: Great breakfast, super nice people. Just what you want in a diner. Get a breakfast bowl or a breakfast sandwich. Both are great.

VcHzPcj6lSEiPG0YuTk1dA.text: Stopped here on a sunday morning with the family.  Nice small traditional diner.  All the food was very good, nothing fancy just basic omelettes and pancakes.  The service was great.  Im sure to be back.

08sKcEhGA-qFIFmW0u2OSA.text: I have driven up and down rt65 hundreds of times and only recently found out about this gem from a friend. They have fantastic food! Whether you're in the mood for breakfast, or want a fantastic sandwich, this place will definitely not disappoint. The atmosphere is what you would picture a classic diner being. A few tables, a bar with stools, and that  amazing aroma of fresh, Home-cooked food. The staff is extremely friendly, and really seem like they care about the quality of food that they provide. I would highly recommend stopping in for bite (Just make sure you bring cash)!

BOgmNWoL9MMQgRxsPUa3bQ.text: Great food. Great local feel.  Several "regulars" were coming in while we were there which gives off a good vibe. They use Mancini's Bread which is always a breakfast favorite. All the breakfast classics are on the menu for reasonable prices.  I had the hot sausage and cheese scramble which was lovely! My husband had a veggie omelette and was not disappointed.  Very small dining area.

t4NzV-FFJz3ppfvgknO0rg.text: Great morning breakfast in Emsworth with my best friend! We had eggs delicious hash browns bacon and toast. The coffee was delicious. It is so nice to have a breakfast spot in my little home town.

-uQwdK3WpFZxz01PyLlsQA.text: Amazing food and service! Very friendly family feel. A couple of neighborhood dogs walked by with their owners and the owner walked outside with bacon to give them. Loved the place and will definitely be going back again!

cOsnSI4dRJH9nhRWEpaU_Q.text: Note: Place only accepts cash!!  I knew exactly what to expect with this Emsworth brunch place (as Emsworth and Bellvue are not necessarily 'brunch' type of places) and it lived up to my expectations.  The place is settled in a neighborhood and has street parking out front. A counter and a few small tables make it the type of place where you feel like the entire restaurant could start having a conversation at any moment. During brunch, an older gentleman wondered into the store with fresh herb plants to give (sell?) to the owner. Fit in perfectly with the friendly feel.  Staff was welcomeing and seemed like they'd been waitressing for decades. I opted for the breakfast bowl which was similar to the type of food I'd be able to make myself if I had the ingredients. The potatoes, cheese and bacon made for a hearty meal. Nothing especially crazy if you're looking for unique brunch food, but it's a great place to enjoy breakfast.

RhAYVyABUfUu-AEuAAoi2w.text: Chev & Rachel's offers the BEST breakfast in Pittsburgh.  My husband and I make it a point to eat here every time we are in the area.  A small but mighty establishment, this adorable neighborhood restaurant offers creative and delicious "down home" breakfast combinations for an excellent price.  The  experience is like coming home- the atmosphere welcoming and relaxing. This place is a MUST for those of you who enjoy a hearty breakfast.

mXsuLo7Zv9_nx8iSgPHnoA.text: We headed here based on Yelp reviews after The Great Race to get away from downtown and snag some brunch.   Tucked back in a residential neighborhood, this place is TINY! A counter and half a dozen tables is all there is to it.  The menu is simple breakfast fair...eggs, omlettes, pancakes and hash brown scrambles. Prices are fair to cheap.  My husband ordered the breakfast bowl with  ham and rye toast and deemed it "just ok." I had the basic breakfast bowl and bacon chocolate chip pancakes.  Let me tell you about those pancakes.  Wow.  If I'd only ordered those, I might have given this place five stars. Unfortunately the breakfast bowls were 3-4 star worthy...so I'm going with 4 overall.  If you want a treat though, go in for those delicious bacon chocolate chip pancakes, you won't regret it!

USPi9rV1gk1hxJCry7XI5w.text: Chev and Rachel's is a destination worthy of your stop.  Personable, friendly, delicious and fast service with generous portions make for a fully satisfying experience.  Here you will see the entire family pitching in to make this "the" place for a memorable breakfast.  Definitely 5 stars!

tPE4AzgiunigC8XDRaZ8MA.text: Awesome breakfast!!! Great, friendly staff.... I drove all the way from Florida just to eat here.

photos.caption: Photo of Chev & Rachel's Family Diner - Emsworth, PA, United States

Y49Yyk7w1r8bUptZ55r6Ug.text: My boyfriend and I been here 3 times and it was delicious each time. Service is fast and very friendly. Will definitely keep coming for weekend breakfasts!

7ZzMtDY8G1oHU6uRMBLMIw.text: Sweet neighborhood diner. Good food, nice staff.  I really enjoyed the French toast made with croissants and blueberry.

9LiPNGJTs_9blFhJr8gz7g.text: Stopped in to give this new neighborhood diner a try.  Standard fare, small menu, but very well done. Hubby had an omelet of american cheese, bacon and green peppers with a side of home fries and toast. He deemed his breakfast "delicious".  I had scrambled, bacon, toast and homes fries. Bacon was the perfect amount of crispy, the toast was nicely done. I appreciated the home fries, not a drop of grease to be had! The scrambled eggs however were brown and a little bit dry.  We both had sodas to drink and they are a very large size. The waitress (owner?) kept us refilled. She kept incredibly busy with prepping and such. Her husband (I believe?) was doing the cooking. Both friendly, talkative people. Prices are right on the mark too.  It's nice to have something new and local and different to us. But be warned, they close at 1:30!

V2rCsawCpFv5_pYmqht8uw.text: Quaint family diner with delicious food! The only thing better than the food is the service!!! Will definitely go back

CwIfm7YGSzpv74W1A2xCGw.text: Have been seeing post and recommendations about Chev & Rachel's but didn't get to experience it until today. WOW, breakfast was awesome. Highly recommend the hot sausage omelet. My better half had the French toast and also said it was great.   Nice family owned establishment that appreciates your business. We will be back for sure.

Hsshkax5FRw-FYU6rfT1jg.text: Best thing to happen to Emsworth.  Great food, great people.   My only issue is I wish they could change the lighting to something softer and warmer.  The place is lit up with obnoxious fluorescent like a bright white classroom.  Almost blinding.

cUd3oP9qf04WFpytFyYq-g.text: Food is good comes out fast and it is very affordable for the amount you get. I never leave that place hungry. And the service staff is really friendly and funny. Nice little local breakfast place perfect for the weekends.

gwxi_L7UHPJ6JrC3REFghw.text: This is a small neighborhood diner. The food is awesome and the service is quick once you get seated. The prices are low enough that if I lived with-in walking distance, I would eat breakfast here everyday. The only reason this place doesn't get 5 stars is that they have a dozen tables and three dozen people that want to sit down and eat.

ZNmex2gD9Ro9ysRWrKgeKQ.text: Very cute little diner. You get a bunch of food for you dollar, and the staff are very friendly. As soon as you walk in, you feel very welcome. Worth a try if you love brunch

naYpAcUBGWJla9JOy_R6AQ.text: I've been here a couple times and have loved everything. The grilled cheese is amazing and you can't go wrong with any breakfast item. The food comes quick and service is always great. It is cash only, so keep that in mind.

SUJp7W-X4Byi15SRzrLBOA.text: Great little, almost hidden place!  Was there recently with my siblings for breakfast. My sisters had breakfast croissant sandwiches with the potatoes. My brother had chocolate chip pancakes. I had buttermilk pancakes and bacon.   Pancakes are fluffy, gigantic and just a touch sweet. Everyone loved their choices. Delicious. Really reasonable prices. Owner was super friendly.   Can't wait to go back!

D55O97hPgLkNT7zO-raWdw.text: Very nice little place. First time there. Quick service at 8:30 am. I sat at counter...seats 5. About 6 tables as well. Very bright and clean with big windows overlooking the street. Extensive breakfast menu. Will be back to try the lunch menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Chev & Rachel's Family Diner - Emsworth, PA, United States
Photo of Chev & Rachel's Family Diner - Emsworth, PA, United States. The Breakfast Bowl! Come hungry for this!

Sp19rBT1g98ns9lk8S1DrQ.text: Great little find!  Off the beaten path, but worth the trip.  Good sign when you walk in at 1115 and it is full of locals.  Quick turn around... food served in under 10 minutes from order...  and cheap!  If I lived near, would be a regular!

1TaNSXtG9d9W_fqv-ncvhA.text: Wife and I were in Pittsburgh looking for a house and we needed a great breakfast spot. We sore Chev & Rachels Family Diner on Yep and decided to give it a shot. From the outside it looks a bit run down. The inside is on the small side has maybe enough room for 20 people. Dont let that detract you as the service is totally amazing. I had 2 eggs over easy with bacon and home fries and the food was super great and cooked perfectly. Chev & rachels is definitely the place to go and I recommend it 100%. You can be sure I will be going there a lot in the future. Only draw back if you want to consider it a drawback is they only take cash. No big deal to me but remember to bring cash or you won't be able to get the best breakfast ever.

photos.caption: Photo of Chev & Rachel's Family Diner - Emsworth, PA, United States

pYcprHk_Bs0STuCZLJRPZw.text: The cutest, small diner in Emsworth. We were the first people in the restaurant so we were helped immediately. I ordered French toast. Very good but nothing exceptional. Reasonably priced. The staff was very friendly and made it a very enjoyable experience. I loved the small town diner feel. I am only giving it 4 stars because nothing stood out to me as "wow." They don't have a parking lot so you will have to park on the street but there were a lot of open spots when we went. They also have the option of outdoor seating.

2vvjPWQsokA1rgj9phkVkA.text: This is the definition of a hole in the wall restaurant! Very small, almost too small. Sat at the counter with my boyfriend and very quick service. The prices are reasonably cheap I feel for the portion. I don't have anything bad to say about the food, we just ordered pancakes, one for each of us. However, it was double the size I thought it was going to be and couldn't finish it all, but gave my best attempt (probably 2/3 of the way eaten). My boyfriend watched as the waitress took my plate and overheard her and the cook mention about how much of a waste I was being and gave us slight glares. I was not impressed and didn't feel welcome, just because I couldn't finish my meal, that I paid for? I understand that wasting food isn't the best, but to give me the third degree because I couldn't finish it? Not cool. Probably won't be returning.

sATOV6qOgzi3P93xSE8XQA.text: Well, you can't beat the price. Breakfast for my wife and I (ham-and-cheddar omelet, toast, coffee; three eggs, toast, coffee) was only $10. Also worth noting that our coffee was free with the Yelp check-in offer.  My wife's eggs were fine as were both our orders of Mancini's toast. And the gentleman who waited on us was friendly and fast. But my omelet was not very good at all.  You can see the from the picture that it didn't even look that great, almost like it was covered in pancake batter.   It was disappointing because we like supporting small, local, family-run diners like Chev and Rachel's. Maybe we just caught them on a bad day.

photos.caption: Photo of Chev & Rachel's Family Diner - Emsworth, PA, United States. ham-and-cheddar omelet. Covered in some type of batter or something.

S9pta5L7fmg3b4kFNhyEzQ.text: Great food w awesome proportions run by a caring family. You won't be disappointed!  Chev works hard to make your breakfast and lunch an experience to remember.  If you want a local joint this is it!

pZC4JXEONIon3kZyqSEHNw.text: Basic small town mom and pop that has a great vibe and quality food.  Only been for breakfast but after 3-4 visits have never been disappointed. Always a solid group of regulars at counter and tables are hard to come by but if you have to wait a few minutes no big deal.  Very friendly staff.  Would recommend to anyone who's even thinking about going to Eat N Park.  Step out and try a real homemade breakfast !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Chev & Rachel's Family Diner - Emsworth, PA, United States

IdCE058yFMWaIjcSOf8g0w.text: Love Chev & Rachel's diner.  Best breakfast in town.  The staff is fabulous and friendly.

F9gcq-RIa7WriC8woS8CFw.text: This place is great! As soon as we walked in we were greeted like regulars, even though we'd never been there! Great start! We arrived mid morning, so we were between breakfast & lunch & it was not crowded. Just one other couple that we came to find out was also waiting for their dog to be done at PVSEC (vets). I ordered eggs & bacon & one pancake & my husband ordered a burger. We were chatting with one of the gentleman ( I think he may have been the owner) and telling him about dieting & low carbs etc, he shared that he lost a lot of weight doing Keto. We told him we were splurging & having whatever to eat & he surprised us with a slice of Mancini's bread toasted with butter. Oh my, it was the best thing ever! He made our day with the toast, great food, and conversation. I'm not from that area, but if you're looking for a cool place for a bite to eat, this is it!

EJ0Q2rdtxa_3X42-VMAP-g.text: So, we are from the other side of town- looking for a place to eat while doing business in the area. First it's one of those places where you can't tell who the owner is because everyone is so kind and customer focused. - it's small and quaint. 22 chairs as my 7 year old counted.  My husband and I had eggs over medium, meat potatoes and Mancini toast for $6.00. the kids had pancakes.  The pancakes were dense and hearty- so if you are hungry 2 will fill you up for $4.00.   So I'm a stickler for my carbs. I love the mancinis toast. If a diner doesn't have it, I don't go.  And the POTATOES guys.  They were cooked all the way through. And dark and crunchy on the outside.  No ketchup needed.   It's cash only- but for some reason most great diners are.  Mismatched mugs, great coffee, warm smiles.  I'll be back.

NACA6py_0FmKM25Ye34elQ.text: Fantastic food and fantastic owners. The food is classic small diner food, the service is impeccable. Even if you have to wait a few minutes for a seat its well worth it.

GUBSIfM1G-GbbPs2DMPgXQ.text: Had a great breakfast. Chev served us and was really friendly. Locals who are repeat customers came in and he knew what they wanted. Located in a residential area with lots of character. I highly recommend this place.
